Loisir Hotel Seoul Myeongdong
8 Very good
Based on 2138 reviews

The hotel situated at very good location, you can found it when exit from Myeongdong Station Exit 6. The Airport Limousine bus stop also just 3 min away from the hotel.

You will enter the Myeongdong Shopping district right away after you stepped out from the hotel. The Nature Republic shop is literally just behind the hotel. My room also got a superb view of N Seoul Tower, just the window need to be cleaned to have unblocked view. There's also a 7-11 shop at 1st floor of the hotel which is quite convenient. Do note that hotel does not provide tooth brush, tooth paste so remember to bring own one. The hotel also charge you if you request early check-in but the hotel do provide you luggage storage lockers and allow you to use free for first 8 hours. Overall, I'll recommend this hotel for its superb location.

Show more
Xin , Malaysia
Nine Tree Premier Hotel Myeong dong 2
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1393 reviews

Stayed for 5d4n in their 'Standard Double' room (Room no. 1107). Agoda stated that it is with KING size bed.

However the bed provided is only in QUEEN size, thus abit dissapointed. We arrived early at about 11.30am and granted an early checked in, this is really nice treat as we all are really tired after a 6 hours flight. Sadly i didn't manage to get the N Seoul Tower view room, our room is facing the front side, no spectacle view from our room. However the cleanliness of the room is top notch. As this is a very new hotel, everything is new and modern. Room is equipped with L-shape sofa, writing table, safebox, small fridge, hair dryrer, usb port socket, bathrope, bathtub and commplete set of toiletries. Hotel is very close to Euljiro 3(sam)-ga subway station (green and orange line), about 5 mins walk. The airport limousine bus (no.6015) also stop at Euljiro 3(sam)-ga bus stop. Walking distance about 800 meters to popular Myeongdong street. We even walking back from N Seoul Tower to the hotel, the distance is about 2.5 km and since it is going downhill from N Seoul Tower, the walk is very easy. Hotel has a gym and lounge at level 18 which we can enjoy the free flow of coffee all day long. Each floor itself also has a 'refresh room' fitted with water dispenser machine, ice cube machine, microwave oven and ironing tools. This is very good as we can save the money on buying the drinking water or mineral water. However at the hotel lobby, there is a 24 hours convenient store (G25) where we bought our T-Money card. There is also a laundry services located at the basement.The staff is very friendly, make sure you get the tourist map from the hotel concierge as the map really help, the map show very details of each subway station exits. Bare in mind it is very confusing with so much exits in a subway station. With the map guidance, we easily head to our exit without much hassle. Overall i will say this is a very good hotel.

Show more
leong , Malaysia
Dormy Inn Premium Seoul Garosugil
8.9 Excellent
Based on 687 reviews

I stayed here for 3 nights and i would said I will be back again. We took airport bas 6009 from incheon airport and the bas drop us in front of DELONGHI bas stop and we cross the road opposite bas stop and u will reach the hotel.

From hotel to Incheon airport you just have to the airport bas 6009 opposite DELONGHI. So the two bas stop is actually just opposite to each other. Breakfast here are amazing with varieties of choice(western, Korean, japanese style) , free spa from 3:00pm to next day morning 10am, free welcome drink coffee, tea, corn tea start from 3:00pm to 12:00pm if I'm not mistaken.Free ramen i got no chance to taste it because usually i back late to the hotel. Free shuttle bus service to MYEONGDONG , DONGDAEMUN. Free spa provided with shampoo, conditioner, body shampoo, hair dryer and also toner, moisturizer. Pajamas is provided. Laundry service are free but you need to pay won 2000 for the 45 mins dryer service. Free Spa provided with shampoo, conditioner, body shampoo, toner & moisturizer. Subway sinsa station exit 8 is near with the hotel within 2 to 3 mins and you can go anywhere you want very easily. Garosugil is near with the hotel around 10mins walk. There are a lots of food place for you to explore if u walk around that area behind the hotel. Front desk are polite and helpful. They can speak english as well. Hotel guest can enjoy 20% discount at Twosomeplace Coffee right behind the hotel. Just show them your room card will do.

Show more
taryn , Malaysia
Days Hotel Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1264 reviews

Once you exit from myeongdong station exit 5, walk straight and you will see another hotel first then gongcha.

Issac toast is located just beside Days hotel. Some of the rooms are smaller. My sis and I were lucky that our room was bigger than my friend's room that's just next to us. Their room was so small that they have difficulty in opening their luggages. The airport bus was about 5 to 10 mins away from the hotel which do not require you to carry the heavy luggages now to the metro station. It cost about 15,000 won per pax. We were told that the hotel can help us to call for jumbo taxi. The taxi fare will be 70,000 won. We (4 person) have too many baggages and thought it would be good to save us some walking distance by paying abit more. To our horror, the taxi driver charged us 95,000 won instead of the fare told by the hotel. We are unsure if we got scammed or the information provided by the hotel was incorrect.

Show more
wan , Singapore
Tmark Grand Hotel Myeongdong
8.7 Excellent
Based on 1101 reviews

Clean and new hotel, 1 min walk to subway station (Hoehyun) which is 1 station from Myungdong station.

However, nothing is open in this area at night so I would recommend staying at Myungdong station instead. Hotel staff are generally polite and nice, except for a concierge staff called Jeongmin Mun at the Concierge who has REALLY POOR attitude. We asked if they could get a taxi for us to go to the airport, to which he replied "WE DO NOT HAVE ANY TAXI SERVICE". We then asked again and he said "YOU NEED TO TAKE IT YOURSELF" with a rolling-eye facial expression. He also gave us attitude for not shutting the hotel door properly and leaving it half open. I think T Mark Grand Hotel should fire him - never had I encountered such horrible service from a concierge staff for a reasonable request for taxi to airport.

Show more
Yan , Hong Kong
Lotte Hotel Seoul
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2091 reviews

Maybe my 5 star hotel stays is different from what they consider 5 star. I stayed in the new wing building, the carpet was a bit stained, and the bathroom tub and counter had an unprofessional caulking job.

The tub was chipped, so it looked like they were trying to cover it up with white enamel paint, but the coating was too thin that you could see the black chip underneath it, that's why I gave it 3 stars. With that said, cleanliness is definitely 5 stars. Staff, the only reason I gave it 3 stars is that there seem to be a lack of American speaking staff, even in the registration area. either the Korean accent was too heavy that it was hard to understand them (my mom speaks with a heavy Korean accent and I can understand her and her friends) so it was really heavy that asking them to repeat a few more times didn't help me. Facilities - gorgeous, it is a beautiful hotel in the lobby area, 5 star worthy but in the room I felt I was in a Marriott. Overall, the reason that I would come back here is for the location, it can't be beat! it's literally right across the street from the Myeong Dong shopping area and the street food, you can choose to cross the street, or go under the hotel where there is an underground shopping center and subway system with great signage that me and my 2 children did not get lost. So on the days it rained we used the underground to walk, and on clear days we chose the street to cross. Under the hotel, Lotte has their own grocery store and a huge food court, so you don't have to go far for food, I only wished it opened earlier and closed later. I believe they opened at 10:30am and closed by 8:30pm. There are a lot of places opened in the surrounding areas though, and it was very safe. There's even a Starbucks right across the street.

Show more
Angela , United States
Hotel PJ Myeongdong
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7490 reviews

me and mom stayed for the 1st time in PJ last month for 5nights, we arrived very early morning. we knew there was room available but PJ asked us to pay the charge for early c/i.

we refused, the front officer even suggested us to go to jimjilbang nearby for shower ect (we came from a long haul flight), however, as she looked us very tired (perhaps) she offered me to join the membership for free and as a member we entitle for free early c/i. Great! of course i was gladly to join. First we only stayed for 1 night, next day we went to other cities so we left our big luggage ata the hotel, they kept it safe for free. when we're back to check in again, we again arrived early and as member, we are allowed to check in early without charge plus, they upgraded our room to ladies room. The standard and ladies room has a quite similar size room (spacious), the plus point is, in ladies room they provide a leg massage machine and there's a water dispenser to refill our bottle (at the alley). PJ hotel also provide a free hanbok for photoshoot, you must register thou. we didnt use the shuttle coz we missed the schedule couple times. for service, PJ had given the good ones, Kaori-san helped us finding some info, she also gave us free coffee coupons and bookmarks. after check-out we left our luggages for couple hours before our night flight, they have a locker rent for free for less than a day rent. about the location; if you have big heavy luggages with you, dragging them to chungmuro station exit 1 (with escalator) is quite challenging, for food, no worries, a lot of small local restaurants nearby which open until midnight. cross the street, as the way to chungmuro station, take the right side of the road, there will alley filled with restaurants. at night the road quite dark, some drunk guys out from the restaurant but still safe , just walk and avoid the drunkers.

Show more
Oei , Indonesia
Nine Tree Hotel Myeong-dong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4692 reviews

For a solo and first time traveller, the hotel staff were very helpful. Alice Jung recommended few restaurants and even went the extra mile to call the restaurants to ask if they served solo customer for budaejjigae! I was so touched by her kind gesture! The location of the hotel was great for shopping in Myeong Dong.

I was lost on my first day though. Upon alighting from the airport shuttle bus, look for the bakery Tous les Jours and walk into the alley. The hotel would be just right in front. There was a mini mart opposite the hotel which sold snacks at a slight discount so one can always do last minute shopping for those snacks sold in Lotte! There was also a weighing scale at the lobby to weigh luggages and the hotel room was clean. I stayed in a standard double room. I must say that there was not much space to move around in the room. Due to the space constraint, it was hard to fully open my luggage to pack/unpack. With this experience, I might consider booking a single room if I am alone for more walking space in the room. I was also dissatisfied with the air-conditioner. No doubt that the air-conditioner was blowing strong and working, however, once the temperature in the room was the same as the preset A/C temperature, the air-conditioner would shut down automatically and would only turn on after 10 minutes or so. I have also confirmed it with the staff. You can imagine one minute I would be cold, and another minute, I would be perspiring once the air-conditioner shut down. Other than the air-conditioning system, Nine Tree Hotel has been great for my first visit in Korea!

Show more
AN , Singapore
Royal Hotel Seoul
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1564 reviews

Accordingly to Royal Hotel Seoul, there is free airport shutter from Gimpo Airport at 2.30 pm but you have to book in advance.

I booked 2 months before my trip, however, after waiting for 45 minutes, no one came so I had to call the hotel and they told me the driver did not see us and left. I found that it was not possible because my friends and I were waiting at Gate 1 2F from 2.10pm. After 2 calls, the hotel's conceige person asked us to take a taxi to hotel but there were 4 of us and we had 4 big luggage so we took a Jumbo taxi which cost us 42000 won. Then the hotel told us it was too expensive and forced us to accept 50% refund for the taxi fare. However, the next day, the customer service manager whom she was sent by her manager to call us and talked to us that the taxi's receipt showed the timing which was 2.20pm boarded the taxi but we told her the timing was wrong, the timing should be 3.20pm. She had to check and later confirmed that the taxi's timing was wrong and apologized. I found it weird that why such a big Michelin hotel never did the checking before you talked to your guests and guests had to proof the taxi's timing was wrong as well as the timing of calling the hotel. It is disappointing!

Show more
Yin , Singapore
Crown Park Hotel Myeongdong Seoul
8.5 Excellent
Based on 782 reviews

We like the hotel but we had bad impression with one of the staff at check-in name Mr. Jimmy Noh. His Enlish is alright but the way he talks is not appropriate for speaking with customer.

I felt like he yelled at me and he seems to back down when I tried yelling too. Might be Korean manner that people must yell and complain to show power and gain some respect, I don't know but I saw it happened in the airplane too. We had a 3 beds and we can moved it by ourselves to close the gap between bed so our 4 yr daughter can sleep in the middle one. We have free breakfast for 1 and child under 4 can eat free. In front of hotel is full of people smoking. We use the KAL bus (16,000w) at Westin to airport which is very convenient.

Show more
Pornbhajara , Thailand
Amanti Hotel Seoul
8.5 Excellent
Based on 633 reviews

I like to sleep at a temperature of around 24.5 C (76 F) in the summer. Unfortunately, the air conditioning in the room is not able to get down to such a temperature.

Making huge noise, it struggles just to get to the 25-26 C range (around 78 F). This is unacceptable as, leaving the A/C off, the temp even at nigh is around 27 C (81 F) based on the central air system. The hotel has nice rooms and good bathroom (though would like full shower glass), but should not have tried to cut expenses around the A/C. I would use this hotel during the spring/fall/winter, but absolutely not during summer. I could not sleep well due to the A/C noise (even after I changed rooms on my next stay) as the A/C struggled to get down to my desired temp. Gym is nice for the price, with an OK range of dumbbells, a pullup/dip station, and a bench for using the dumbbells on. They have a pool (closes at 8pm or for mid-July to mid-Aug at 10pm). The lobby is very nice, spacious, and comfortable compared to other mid-level hotels. Staff are friendly and efficient. Laundry service is not so great. They could not repair loose buttons (despite my request) and the washed clothes had a harsh chemical smell.

Show more
Sean , United States
Oakwood Premier Coex Center
8.7 Excellent
Based on 585 reviews

Being from U.S., and needing a king size bed to accommodate myself, my wife, and a 13 month old, Oakwood presented itself as one of the more reasonably priced 4-5star hotels.

I never heard anything of the hotel. But once we got there, I was definitely impressed. The room we booked was more an apartment than a hotel room. Complete with kitchen, living room, bedroom, and even a washer/dryer laundry machine. The location was perfect. Located right on top of the Coex mall, you can take the elevator down right to the mall, or the casino next door. The subway was also not that far off and can be walked to without stepping outside. Next door is the Air City terminal where you can actually check in your luggage for your departure flight then just hop a bus straight to the airport. I also stayed at the Intercontinental next door, but actually preferred the Oakwood, due to its bigger room size and more centered location within the Coex. The only downside I would say is the one dining experience I had there (breakfast buffet) was not all that compared to the breakfast buffets at some of the other 5star hotels. Also, the other 5 star hotel staff definitely spoke better English. Don't get me wrong, Oakwood staff was very accommodating and friendly, and this would not stop me from choosing them again. All in all, this place is a hidden gem. Definitely would recommend it to friends traveling to Seoul.

Show more
John , United States
Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 3487 reviews

SkyPark is easily accessible from icn, it's just a 5mins walk from bus6015-royal hotel stop. It's located in myeongdong area where food & shopping are at your doorsteps, yet quiet enough for a good rest.

The staff greets me every time I step into the hotel & are helpful with all my enquiries on directions. Namdaemun market is a 15 -20mins walk away from the hotel , while myeongdong station is 5-10 mins away. There is also free shuttle bus service between Seoul station to the hotel. This service is good for people traveling to Seoul via the AREX and make visits to Lotte Mart easy. I liked the free water dispenser ( serving both Hot & cold water ) on every floor. However , I was unable to do an early check in . But this is fine for me, as I was given a room at high floor ( as requested upon booking) Elderly might find the walk to train station tedious, but you can utilise the free shuttle bus service to Seoul station to access to your destinations.

Show more
Regina , Singapore
Tmark Hotel Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 785 reviews

the experience has not been pleasant during my stay of 7 nights with my friends. We were not even greeted by the staff, Lawrence when we did our check-in on the first night.

He did not explain to us on the dos and dont' or even inform us on the check out timing. I also had to ask for the wifi password ( there isn't for this hotel after finding out from him). One of my friends require assistance to the nearest hospital during our stay there as he was feeling breathless. We asked the female counter staff and she gave us a map in korean words. We requested for her to write the hospital's name in English. Sadly, she spelt out the word ' hospital' instead of writing the English name of the hospital for us. She also told us that as the hospital is a walking distance (5 mins walk away), she is not able to call for any taxi. It's really disappointing for the service that this hotel has. It's an emergency but no care and assistance was provided promptly. Will never recommend or go back to this hotel though they do have a very good fried chicken stall near by.

Show more
Priscilla , Singapore
The Shilla Seoul
9 Excellent
Based on 744 reviews

Believe the hype, the Shilla hotel is simply one of the very best, if not THE best hotel in Korea. From the lavishly decorated surroundings, to the large, beautiful lobby, to the many gourmet restaurants, top-notch facilities, expertly-trained staff, and outstanding guest rooms, what more can you want in a 5-star luxury hotel? Even the most basic guest room is large, modern, and meticulously clean.

The bedding, in particular, is the most luxurious and comfortable I've ever experienced....better than in most 5-star hotels I've stayed at inculding the best in the US and Europe. The staff are expertly trained, fluent in multiple languages, and very attentive. The facilities, esp. the outdoor pool, fitness center, and spa are amazing. I would also highly recommend the dinner buffet at the Parkview restuarant....expensive but not to be missed! The location is good in that it's up on a hill, away from traffic noise, but a little bad in that a quick access to surrounding neighborhood is a bit difficult.

Show more
Peter , United States
Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeongdong
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1178 reviews

If you’ve decided to stay in Myeongdong, Solaria is right smack in the middle of the action. And it’s just 3, 4 minutes' walk to Myeongdong subway and the airport limousine bus stop.

Top-notice quality and comfort. Plus everything is still new and clean as the hotel is only a little over a year old. The room hallway is longish, so the bed area becomes a bit small. Decent hotel with basic facilities and amenities. Nothing to complaint for the price paid. The hotel is surrounded with alot of eateries and convenient stores. Finding foods never an issue. The only complaint I have was the "pillar" in the room (I booked the deluxe double) that blocked the walking space in the 24sqm room. Kind of weird. The hotel offers free shuttles to key business buildings and to shopping areas. For those who are heading to the airport, I would suggest to take the free shuttle from hotel to Seoul Station at 10am, 1230pm, 2pm, 3.30pm an 4.30pm (Weekdays) and 9.30am, 10.50am, 1pm, 4.20pm, 3.40pm and 7pm (Weekend). The journey is about 10 mins or less depending on traffic. Then head straight to AREX departure hall (Level B2) for the express train to the airport. The one-way AREX train ticket is 8,000KRW and the express train takes 43 min from Seoul to Incheon (every 30 min), 10 min walk to airport check-in counter at Incheon Airport). The airport limousine bus stop for 6701 (16,000KRW one way) is quite closed to the hotel, yet a distance for us to walk, especially with heavy luggages. The estimated travel journey is around 90 min, depending on traffic condition and also how full is the each limousine bus. If the bus load is full, you have to wait for another 20 to 25 min.

The guesthouse is only a few mins walk away from the Ginpo/ Incheon airport bus/shuttle bus stops and the MRT station.

This is very convenient for those travelling with luggages since they need not transfer from one bus to another. The station is also very near the Myeong dong shopping district, and has close proximity to convenience stores, Korean bbq restaurants, coffee shops, fastfood chains and the Lotte department stores. We visited Seoul during the grand Korea Sale so the location coulnd't have been more perfect. It is also around 10-15 minutes walk away from the cable car station going to N Seoul Tower. The staff was very friendly and helpful, offering assistance on tours and city directions. The staff can also speak English fluently, which might probably explain why a lot of foreigners were there alsk when we visited (most of them are returning customer). The guesthouse also offer hearty and yummy self-service breakfast from 8 am to 11 am. The floors and the rooms are well heated during winter and are very clean--- the standard double room comes with TV, ref, and free wifi. You just have to request for bath towels since what they have are a number of small towels in the room. Body wash, shampoo and conditioners are also available for free, with heated showers. Not all rooms though have bathrooms all to themselves, you just have to check the room types. However, shared bathrooms/shower rooms are clean as there are cleaninng staff who come in regularly. The guesthouse is also situated in a quiet and secure location- just be prepared to walk a little bit uphill from the main road. They also have a cute homey backyard where you can eat and do barbecue (too bad for us, we can't do so because it was freezing when we visited). We recommend this guesthouse for couples, solo backpackers, and even for small families with kids. We will definitely come back to this guesthouse on our next visit to Seoul.

Generally a nice place. They keep the rooms and general areas clean and it has a good location for going out and exploring Hongdae.

However, we had some issues. First, it took us about 45 minutes just to check in. To be fair, we made our booking very late in the day so the fact that our names weren't on the list and the staff member had to call the boss was not a problem. However, they were on the phone for more than 20 minutes before it was clear to us what the problem was and we could help solve it. Once we knew what the issue was it was relatively simple to solve, so it all just took a needlessly long time. For future reference, our problem was we booked on Agoda, but our booking was actually managed by booking.com (this information was rather hidden in the confirmation). Bookings with Agoda are paid in advance and ones with booking.com are not. So, just make sure you're clear which site you booked with and if you paid or not. Another issue was our room was absolutely freezing. All the windows were open when we got there and it's the middle of winter! The staff member told us to close them and she would turn on the heat. We left soon after arriving so we didn't realize there was an issue. When we came back, the heat was not on and the room was still freezing cold. You can't control the heat from your room and it was late so we couldn't inform a staff member, so we slept very poorly because of the uncomfortable temperature. I just wanted to describe our experience, I think we might have been a bit unlucky.

This is a cramped but clean, cheap and conveniently located place with wifi and a shared kitchen. Warning, my room "bathroom" was your typical Korean guesthouse shower: stand in front of sink right next to toilet and spray self with sink hose and water flows into floor drain.

I'm used to this but other guests might be surprised. The room is tiny and tall travelers (6 feet or 182 cm) will suffer. Think of it as a comfortable jail cell. There is no individual room temperature control but the staff can give you something to restrict the air going into your room. It was October and room too heated so I opened the window. But the room was fairly clean, and friendly staff spoke just enough English and Japanese. You might want a translator app ready just in case. I had a tiny refrigerator and there is a small shared kitchen and pc. The guesthouse is located very close the subway entrance but sign is in Korean and hard to find so it took me 10 minutes to find it. Don't panic - Koreans are gruff and hurried but very friendly and helpful and will help you find it. I suggest printing up a picture of the guesthouse name in Korean and showing it to nearby store clerks (female solo travelers should ask other women) if you are lost. There is no elevator so don't bring too much luggage. The location is great! There are convenience stores and many restaurants and shops nearby. At night, street stalls sell food for only 3000 won. Once you memorize the guesthouse location then you can easily use the subway to explore Seoul. Now if you want a fancy deluxe hotel with full service then don't come here. But if all you need is a cheap and convenient place to stay for the night then this place is it. ここは一流ホテルではないけど、すぐ駅の前で、とても安くて、便利な場所です。

More about Seoul

Seoul is a city of enchanting history and economic success, a destination worthy of both the leisure and business traveler. International travelers are introduced to the city via the Seoul Incheon International Airport. Short term travelers have the option of modern airport hotels, but it is only a 30-minute ride into the city from here.

Those looking to experience the city’s culture have much going for them. The highlight here would be Changdeok-gung, a royal palace dating back to 1405 and a World Heritage Site. Between the grand sites are a collection of royal shrines, Buddhist temples, and museums. The DMZ, or de-militarized zone separating North and South Korea, makes for a worthy day-trip as well.

Shopping is undoubtedly available in abundance here. The areas around Insadong Street are some of the most famous in South Korea, offering gift shops, art galleries, and traditional tea shops. Myeong-dong offers up-market shopping amongst a collection of Western-styled hotels. In Gangnam, visitors will find the upscale dining and entertainment venues. This district also boasts the city’s latest shops and hotels.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Seoul for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

Show more Xin , Malaysia Nine Tree Premier Hotel Myeong dong 2 8.6 Excellent Based on 1393 reviews Stayed for 5d4n in their 'Standard Double' room (Room no. 1107). Agoda stated that it is with KING size bed. However the bed provided is only in QUEEN size, thus abit dissapointed. We arrived early at about 11.30am and granted an early checked in, this is really nice treat as we all are really tired after a 6 hours flight. Sadly i didn't manage to get the N Seoul Tower view room, our room is facing the front side, no spectacle view from our room. However the cleanliness of the room is top notch. As this is a very new hotel, everything is new and modern. Room is equipped with L-shape sofa, writing table, safebox, small fridge, hair dryrer, usb port socket, bathrope, bathtub and commplete set of toiletries. Hotel is very close to Euljiro 3(sam)-ga subway station (green and orange line), about 5 mins walk. The airport limousine bus (no.6015) also stop at Euljiro 3(sam)-ga bus stop. Walking distance about 800 meters to popular Myeongdong street. We even walking back from N Seoul Tower to the hotel, the distance is about 2.5 km and since it is going downhill from N Seoul Tower, the walk is very easy. Hotel has a gym and lounge at level 18 which we can enjoy the free flow of coffee all day long. Each floor itself also has a 'refresh room' fitted with water dispenser machine, ice cube machine, microwave oven and ironing tools. This is very good as we can save the money on buying the drinking water or mineral water. However at the hotel lobby, there is a 24 hours convenient store (G25) where we bought our T-Money card. There is also a laundry services located at the basement.The staff is very friendly, make sure you get the tourist map from the hotel concierge as the map really help, the map show very details of each subway station exits. Bare in mind it is very confusing with so much exits in a subway station. With the map guidance, we easily head to our exit without much hassle. Overall i will say this is a very good hotel. There's a program there where you can stay for free in exchange for working as a cleaning staff for a few hours a day. Most of these guys stay over long periods and for that reason they get comfortable with the guesthouse and the other staff and treat it as home. Nothing wrong with that. But i feel that this big group of people just "conquer" and over run the lounge and make other guests feel like they are not welcomed to use the facilities. Also they are really loud at night slamming doors and talking loudly. It is just something i noticed. I felt as though i was intruding into their family dinner space and they would look at you up and down when you entered into the Show more Hisham , Singapore Justin House 8.8 Excellent Based on 58 reviews 202 House SeoulStation 8.7 Excellent Based on 88 reviews Travelled as a duo with a friend for this trip. The host, Mr Jang is very friendly and helpful. 1 week prior to our stay, he enquired re: our flight and arrival details, and given us transportation details and directions to the apartment which was a plus! When we arrived, he explained to us on how to use the apartment facilities and there even is a file to guide us along if we ever forgotten. We even managed to rent a portable wi-fi from him instead of from the airport since its cheaper. Communication was effortless with him as he is able to converse in english and he replies to enquiries very quick. The apartment itself is strategically located about a 2mins walk from Seoul Station. It is convenient for us since the AREX as well as the KTX are stationed there and there is the Lotte Mart as well. It is also conveniently located near tourists attractions such as N Seoul Tower, Myeongdong and Itaewon. The layout of the apartment is more than big enough for the two of us. The space is clean and neat. There is a kitchen and a washing machine which is convenient for us since we do cook breakfast and wash the clothings on a daily basis. Overall, we really had a pleasant and lovely stay especially for my buddy who is travelling to Seoul for the first time :) Will definitely be staying here again if I'm travelling to Seoul in future. Show more Syahidah , Singapore Grape Garden House 8.1 Excellent Based on 356 reviews Generally a nice place. They keep the rooms and general areas clean and it has a good location for going out and exploring Hongdae. However, we had some issues. First, it took us about 45 minutes just to check in. To be fair, we made our booking very late in the day so the fact that our names weren't on the list and the staff member had to call the boss was not a problem. However, they were on the phone for more than 20 minutes before it was clear to us what the problem was and we could help solve it. Once we knew what the issue was it was relatively simple to solve, so it all just took a needlessly long time. For future reference, our problem was we booked on Agoda, but our booking was actually managed by booking.com (this information was rather hidden in the confirmation). Bookings with Agoda are paid in advance and ones with booking.com are not. So, just make sure you're clear which site you booked with and if you paid or not. Another issue was our room was absolutely freezing. All the windows were open when we got there and it's the middle of winter! The staff member told us to close them and she would turn on the heat. We left soon after arriving so we didn't realize there was an issue. When we came back, the heat was not on and the room was still freezing cold. You can't control the heat from your room and it was late so we couldn't inform a staff member, so we slept very poorly because of the uncomfortable temperature. I just wanted to describe our experience, I think we might have been a bit unlucky. Show more Joel , Sweden Hostel Vanilla Dongdaemun 2 9.2 Exceptional Based on 193 reviews Pros: We stayed at Hostel Vanilla 2 for 8 nights. The hostel location is very convenient as it is located like 3 minutes walk from Dongmyo train station. The hostel & the room is quite small but it is cozy for a couple & two large luggage bags. Daniel & Ted are very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. And we love those cozy breakfast moments with Daniel where we would discussed our itineraries and gossips. Extra hand towels, tooth paste, and tooth brush are always available. Unlimited supply of fresh milk, cereal, bread, eggs, juice, ramen, instant coffee, tea, drinking water etc in the kitchen. Definitely value for money for those who would just need a cozy place to have a simple breakfast, rest, sleep, and hot shower. Suitable for those who would go out all day long. The interior decorations of the hostel are very modern and cute. Simple & clean. The location is away from the main road & away from noisy 'touristy' area/road. Good for those who loves privacy and peace. Cons: Paper thin walls (expected from a hostel). You can literally here people cleaning, talking, giggling, laughing, walking almost all the time (even late at night if you have people coming back late). If you are a light sleeper, we would recommend you to get a proper sound proof room hotel (which will cost you more obviously) as most hostels in Seoul are small and do not have soundproof (thick) walls. For those who are going for your honeymoon and will be spending a lot of time in your room and you also might need extra privacy, we highly suggest that you book a proper Hotel room (not hostel, not homestay, not bed and breakfast). Prepare to spend more on a good Hotel room if you require those above. They don't provide big bath towel. So do bring one if you are not okay using a hand towel (not referring to the usage but to the size) as your bath towel. The hostel location is a bit quiet at night. It is still safe regardless. But try not to walk back alone late at night. But then again, it Show more Raja , Malaysia Guest House Myeongdong 7.6 Very good Based on 1086 reviews This is a cramped but clean, cheap and conveniently located place with wifi and a shared kitchen. Warning, my room "bathroom" was your typical Korean guesthouse shower: stand in front of sink right next to toilet and spray self with sink hose and water flows into floor drain. I'm used to this but other guests might be surprised. The room is tiny and tall travelers (6 feet or 182 cm) will suffer. Think of it as a comfortable jail cell. There is no individual room temperature control but the staff can give you something to restrict the air going into your room. It was October and room too heated so I opened the window. But the room was fairly clean, and friendly staff spoke just enough English and Japanese. You might want a translator app ready just in case. I had a tiny refrigerator and there is a small shared kitchen and pc. The guesthouse is located very close the subway entrance but sign is in Korean and hard to find so it took me 10 minutes to find it. Don't panic - Koreans are gruff and hurried but very friendly and helpful and will help you find it. I suggest printing up a picture of the guesthouse name in Korean and showing it to nearby store clerks (female solo travelers should ask other women) if you are lost. There is no elevator so don't bring too much luggage. The location is great! There are convenience stores and many restaurants and shops nearby. At night, street stalls sell food for only 3000 won. Once you memorize the guesthouse location then you can easily use the subway to explore Seoul. Now if you want a fancy deluxe hotel with full service then don't come here. But if all you need is a cheap and convenient place to stay for the night then this place is it. ここは一流ホテルではないけど、すぐ駅の前で、とても安くて、便利な場所です。 Show more Jayson , United States Serviced Apartment (Seoul Station) 8.1 Excellent Based on 85 reviews Kangs Duplex at Seoul Station 8.9 Excellent Based on 74 reviews Central Apartment 8.7 Excellent Based on 78 reviews This is our first trip to Korea and Seoul. Well before our arrival, the Town Guesthouse host, Jay, contacted us and gave us clear directions in English(!) to the Guesthouse, our room number and password. That was very nice.. On our second morning there (Wed 6th Apr 2016), we realised that we had left our tablet pc in a hotel in Busan when we left the morning before. We immediately contacted Jay and requested his help to call the hotel in Busan as we do not speak Korean and was afraid that the hotel staff in Busan may not understand us well. Initially, Jay could not get through the line, but he persisted and tried many times, and finally managed to get through to the hotel in the afternoon. When we returned to the Guesthouse in the evening, he had good news for us -- the Busan hotel found our tablet pc and after Jay's call, had packed the tablet and sent it to him by courier! We were so happy! On Thurs morning, Jay had more good news -- the tablet pc has arrived! :) Wow! We were amazed at the helpfulness of Jay and the Busan hotel staff and the efficiency of the Korean system!!! With that good start, we had a very pleasant 5 nights stay in the Guesthouse in Seoul. The room we had was well furnished -- just like at home, although we did not use most of the appliances. Jay is a very friendly and good host; he responds quickly to any query that I had... KURNIAWAN ,Indonesia Discover the neighborhoods of Seoul Hongdae 793 hotels Myeong-dong 656 hotels Dongdaemun 423 hotels Gangnam 382 hotels Jongro 344 hotels Gangbuk 176 hotels Itaewon 172 hotels Sinchon 166 hotels Songpa 163 hotels Gwanghwamun 137 hotels Gangseo 124 hotels Apgujeong 121 hotels Samseong-dong 112 hotels Yeong-deungpo 106 hotels Jung-gu 103 hotels Yongsan 98 hotels Gwanak 96 hotels Guro 87 hotels Mapo 78 hotels Seo-daemun 55 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Guest Houses in Seoul 936 Apartments in Seoul 505 Hostels in Seoul 148 Serviced Apartments in Seoul 108 Motels in Seoul 102 Capsule Hotels in Seoul 2 More about Seoul Seoul is a city of enchanting history and economic success, a destination worthy of both the leisure and business traveler. International travelers are introduced to the city via the Seoul Incheon International Airport . Short term travelers have the option of modern airport hotels, but it is only a 30-minute ride into the city from here. Those looking to experience the city’s culture have much going for them. The highlight here would be Changdeok-gung, a royal palace dating back to 1405 and a World Heritage Site. Between the grand sites are a collection of royal shrines, Buddhist temples, and museums. The DMZ, or de-militarized zone separating North and South Korea, makes for a worthy day-trip as well. Shopping is undoubtedly available in abundance here. The areas around Insadong Street are some of the most famous in South Korea, offering gift shops, art galleries, and traditional tea shops. Myeong-dong offers up-market shopping amongst a collection of Western-styled hotels. In Gangnam, visitors will find the upscale dining and entertainment venues. This district also boasts the city’s latest shops and hotels. Be sure to check out the interactive map of Seoul for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.
